meanings.meaning: 1. in the style of (esp. literary, artistic, etc. works); reminiscent of その若い男優はジェームス・ディーン張りの役者だ。That young actor is a James Dean.
2. attached or stretched on
1. stretch; tension この弓は張りが強いです。This bow has a strong draw.
2. resilience; springiness; tone 彼の肌は青年の肌のように張りがある。His skin has the tone of a young man's.
3. will-power; pluck; pride

sentences.translation: That young actor is a James Dean.

1. as expected; sure enough; just as one thought Usually written using kana alone, See also やっぱり「そうか。やはり私のほうが年を食ってる。私は今年で２０うんたら才だ」「いや、わかんねーよ」"Oh? Then, as I expected, I've been around longer than you. This year I'm 20-mumble years old." "What does that tell me?"

2. after all (is said and done); in the end; as one would expect; in any case Usually written using kana alone, See also やっぱり止むを得ず訪問するのはいやだったが、やはりしないわけにはいかなかった。I disliked the idea of the necessary call, but it had to be done.
3. too; also; as well; likewise; (not) either Usually written using kana alone, See also やっぱり
4. still; as before Usually written using kana alone, See also やっぱり
5. all the same; even so; still; nonetheless Usually written using kana alone, See also やっぱり彼は頭がよいがやはり嫌いだ。He's intelligent, but I still don't like him.
矢張り: Ateji (phonetic) reading, Rarely-used kanji form.

sentences.translation: "Oh? Then, as I expected, I've been around longer than you. This year I'm 20-mumble years old." "What does that tell me?"

sentence: わけにはいかなかった
sentences.translation: I disliked the idea of the necessary call, but it had to be done.
He's intelligent, but I still don't like him.

meanings.meaning: 1. business trip; official trip
1. expansion; extension; enlargement
2. escape; ESC Computing
1. as expected; sure enough; just as one thought Usually written using kana alone, See also やはりやっぱり、あなたは私の思ったとおりの人だった。You're just the kind of person I imagined you'd be.

2. after all (is said and done); in the end; as one would expect; in any case Usually written using kana alone, See also やはり北海道に行ったら、やっぱり海の幸を食べないと行った意味がないでしょう。A trip to Hokkaido is not a trip to Hokkaido unless you try the seafood.
3. too; also; as well; likewise; (not) either Usually written using kana alone, See also やはり
4. still; as before Usually written using kana alone, See also やはり私たちの家は快適ですが、やっぱり前の家がなつかしい。Our house is nice, but I still miss the old one.
5. all the same; even so; still; nonetheless Usually written using kana alone, See also やはり疲れているが、やっぱり行くつもりだ。I'm tired, but I'm going anyway.
矢っ張り: Ateji (phonetic) reading, Rarely-used kanji form.

sentences.translation: You're just the kind of person I imagined you'd be.
A trip to Hokkaido is not a trip to Hokkaido unless you try the seafood.
Our house is nice, but I still miss the old one.
I'm tired, but I'm going anyway.

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'ru' ending, Intransitive verb
